message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing symptoms of overactive bladder, and among the options, oxybutynin is the most appropriate intervention to treat overactive bladder symptoms. Pessary placement is used for pelvic organ prolapse, not overactive bladder. Tamsulosin is used for urinary retention due to benign prostatic hyperplasia, and topical estrogen is used for vaginal atrophy.
